      • createParserAndWrapException

        public static <E extends java.lang.Exception> javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser createParserAndWrapException(boolean schemaValidation,
                                                                                       java.lang.Class<E> exceptionClassWrapper)
                                                                throws E extends java.lang.Exception
        Create a prser with schema validation.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the exception wrapper type.
        Parameters:
        schemaValidation - true to enable schema validation.
        exceptionClassWrapper - the exception wrapper class.
        Returns:
        a parser with schema validation enabled.
        Throws:
        E - if an error occurs.
        E extends java.lang.Exception

      • getClassPathEntityResolver

        public static XMLUtil.ClassPathEntityResolver getClassPathEntityResolver()
        Get an entity resolver for resolving classpaths. This is similar to Spring's ResourceEntityResolver except that it doesn't depend on Spring and supports EntityResolver2. If you already are using Spring and do not need support for EntityResolver2 then use the Spring utility.
        Returns:
        the resolver.

      • getIdentity

        public static java.lang.String getIdentity(@Nullable
                           java.lang.String xml)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get an identity string for the specified XML.
        Parameters:
        xml - the XML.
        Returns:
        the identity string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the parser cannot be created.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is invalid.

        public static boolean isEmptyHTMLElement(java.lang.String elementName)
        Return true if the specified element name is an empty element like BR, HR, etc.
        Parameters:
        elementName - the element name.
        Returns:

      • validate

        @Nullable
public static Pair<org.xml.sax.Locator,org.xml.sax.SAXException> validate(org.xml.sax.InputSource data,
                                                                   @Nullable
                                                                   org.xml.sax.ContentHandler contentHandler)
                                                                   throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                                          javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
        Validate the specified xml data.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        contentHandler - a content handler. This may be null.
        Returns:
        a locator and the exception on the first error or null.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - thrown if parser could not be created.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - thrown if parser could not be created.
        java.io.IOException - thrown if data could not be read.

      • validate2

        public static java.util.List<Pair<org.xml.sax.Locator,org.xml.sax.SAXException>> validate2(org.xml.sax.InputSource data,
                                                                           @Nullable
                                                                           org.xml.sax.ContentHandler contentHandler)
                                                                                    throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                                                           javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                                                           java.io.IOException
        Validate the specified xml data.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        contentHandler - a content handler. This may be null.
        Returns:
        a list of locator and the exception indicating errors or an empty list indicating no errors.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - thrown if parser could not be created.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - thrown if parser could not be created.
        java.io.IOException - thrown if data could not be read.

      • writeAttributes

        public static void writeAttributes(java.io.PrintWriter writer,
                   org.xml.sax.Attributes attributes,
                   @Nullable
                   java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> excluded)
        Write the attributes. A space is prepend before each attribute.
        Parameters:
        writer - the writer.
        attributes - the attributes.
        excluded - the attributes to exclude.
